title: Biology Mock Test: Sub-divisions of Biology #Bio001

questions.text: The scientific study of insects is known as
questions.solution: Correct: Entomology (B). It is the scientific study of insects (classification, behaviour, physiology, ecology). Ichthyology = fishes; Parasitology = parasites; Malacology = molluscs.

questions.text: Which of the following subjects of data set is associated with the study of concerning population and humanity?
questions.solution: Correct: Demography (C). It studies human population statistics (size, density, birth/death rates, migration). Ecology = organism-environment; Genetics = heredity; Virology = viruses.

questions.text: Study of Zoology deals with
questions.solution: Correct: Both living and dead animals (C). Zoology covers extant animals and fossils/extinct forms (palaeozoology). Living plants = Botany; dead plants = Palaeobotany.

questions.text: The study of the flower is known as
questions.solution: Correct: Anthology (B). It is the study of flowers (structure, pollination, classification). Phrenology = skull-personality (pseudoscience); Agrostology = grasses; Palynology = pollen/spores.

questions.text: The comparative study of the different cultures and the scientific explanation is known as
questions.solution: Correct: Ethnology (A). Comparative scientific study of cultures and societies. Ethnography = descriptive fieldwork of one culture; Ethology = animal behaviour; Ethics = moral philosophy.

questions.text: The study of properties and method of biological systems found in nature and use of this knowledge in mechanical world is known as
questions.solution: Correct: Bionics (A). Application of biological principles to engineering/technology (biomimetics). Bionomics = organism-environment economics; Bionomy = laws of life; Biometry = biological statistics.

questions.text: Under Palaeobotany, one studies
questions.solution: Correct: None of the above (D). Palaeobotany studies fossil plants only. Animal fossils = Palaeozoology; living algae = Phycology; living fungi = Mycology.

questions.text: Rearing silk worms is known as
questions.solution: Correct: Sericulture (C). Commercial rearing of silkworms (Bombyx mori) for silk. Apiculture = honey bees; Horticulture = garden plants; Floriculture = flowers.

questions.text: Honey bees are used in
questions.solution: Correct: Apiculture (C). Managed beekeeping for honey, wax and pollination. Sericulture = silkworms; Tissue culture = in-vitro cells; Pisciculture = fish farming.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not correctly matched?
questions.solution: Correct mismatch: Vegetable - Horticulture Cultivation (C). Vegetables come under Olericulture. Floriculture = flowers; Agronomy = field crops; Pomology = fruits.

questions.text: Which of the following is not correctly matched?
questions.solution: Correct mismatch: Pisciculture - Insect of lakh (C). Pisciculture = fish farming; lac insect comes under lac culture. Others are correct.

questions.text: Which of the following pairs is correctly matched? (word and meaning)
questions.solution: Correct: Lexicography - Compilation of dictionary (A). Philology = language history; Entomology = insects; Iconography = visual symbols.

questions.text: Lexicography is related to
questions.solution: Correct: Compilation of dictionary (B). It is the science of dictionary making. Anatomy = body structure; Graphology = handwriting; Iconography/pedagogy = images.

questions.text: The study related to the plants being used as vegetable is called
questions.solution: Correct: Olericulture (D). Science of vegetable production. Floriculture = flowers; Pomology = fruits; Horticulture = broad garden crops.

questions.text: Which one of the following is produced through Viticulture?
questions.solution: Correct: Grapes (D). Viticulture = cultivation of grapevines for grapes/wine. Sericulture = silk; Vermiculture = earthworms; Apiculture = honey.

questions.text: What is Vermiculture?
questions.solution: Correct: The science of raising worms (A). Specifically earthworms for vermicompost. Zoology = general animal study; Ichthyology = fishes.

questions.text: In Vermiculture, the worm used is
questions.solution: Correct: Earthworm (D). Eisenia fetida is used for vermicomposting. Others are parasitic or for silk.

questions.text: The study of Gerontology, is related to which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct: Old age (D). Gerontology = scientific study of ageing. Paediatrics = children; Gynaecology = female; Dermatology = skin.

questions.text: Genetics deals with
questions.solution: Correct: Heredity and variations (D). Full scope of genetics. Mendelâ€™s laws, evolution, DNA are specific aspects.

questions.text: The branch of study dealing with old age and ageing is called
questions.solution: Correct: Gerontology (B). Oncology = cancer; Teratology = birth defects; Ornithology = birds.
